transcript:
now what are some healthy coping skills
I think oftentimes we like talk about
the standard stuff like meditation is
actually really really good we can also
do other kinds of things like think
about the things that you do that help
you feel better but also don't set you
up for getting screwed later so there
are unhealthy coping mechanisms things
like you know video games pornography
alcohol substances of abuse all that
kind of stuff and I think social like
reaching out to people socially leaning
on people like for social support
there's overwhelming evidence that
animals can be incredibly helpful for
our mental health I've worked with so
many patients who what literally keeps
them alive they're thinking about
suicide but like who would take care of
their dog or cat and that's actually a
really strong Foundation to build on so
I don't know depending on where you are
in life but like getting a pet is
actually not a bad idea
